_instructions: This JSON defines an entity for the Laravel API generator. Do not remove _instructions key.
_step1: Create a folder named .entities in the project root (this folder is git ignored).
_step2: Copy and rename this file to your entity name in singular PascalCase, e.g., Location.json.
_step3: Add fields in snake_case, e.g., sw_name.
_step5: For foreignId fields, add a 'references' property with the referenced table name.
_step6: Optionally define relations in the 'relations' array. Supported types: oneToOne, oneToMany, manyToMany.
_step7: The generator will automatically add: id, uuid, created_by, updated_by, softDeletes, and timestamps fields.
_step8: Run the generator via Artisan command: php artisan generate:resource
_step9: You will be prompted to select the JSON entity file from .entities folder.
_step10: You will be prompted to choose where to put the controller (Management or Setup folder).
_step11: The generator will create migration, model, controller (with CRUD + Swagger), register the route, and create pivot migrations if needed.
name: MenuItem
